marketNews.title: IHSG Drops -3.4% Today, Compilation of Today's News
Stock Market Plunges, IHSG Drops -3.4%
marketNews.content: IHSG dropped -3.4% on Monday (5/8) - marking the worst daily decline since May 2022 - following various negative sentiments from macroeconomics and global financial markets: Increasing recession concerns in the US following the release of employment data for July 2024 which was far worse than expected. The correction of US technology stocks continues after soaring since the beginning of the year. The Nikkei 225 stock index in Japan fell by -12.4%, following a surprise increase in its benchmark interest rate. Besides macroeconomics and financial markets, geopolitical developments have also worsened with the potential for retaliation from Iran and Hezbollah against Israeli attacks. All IHSG sector indices fell in today's trading. Out of a total of 895 stocks, as many as 592 stocks weakened and only 62 stocks strengthened today.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Although it is difficult to predict how deep the correction will be, we assess that the current market weakness can be used as a momentum to accumulate quality stocks and/or those that routinely distribute dividends, especially those that have experienced a significant price drop. Here are some of our preferences: SIDO (-5.4%), ADRO (-6.9%), PWON (-3.6%).

marketNews.title: Indonesia's GDP Grows +5.05% YoY in 2Q24, Exceeding Consensus in a Context of Weak Government Spending
marketNews.content: Indonesia's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) grew +5.05% YoY in 2Q24 (vs. 1Q24: +5.11% YoY), exceeding consensus expectations at +5%. The latest result emerged amidst weakening government spending which only increased +1.42% YoY (vs. 1Q24: +19.9% YoY), while community consumption grew by +4.93% YoY (vs. 1Q24: +4.91% YoY). On a quarterly basis, Indonesia's economy grew +3.79% QoQ (vs. 1Q24: -0.83% QoQ), exceeding consensus expectations at +3.71% QoQ. This result caused Indonesia's economy in 1H24 to grow +5.08% YoY (vs. 1H23: +5.11% YoY), lower than the government's target which aims for +5.2% growth throughout 2024.

marketNews.title: Axios Reports Potential Iran and Hezbollah Attack on Israel Could Start Within 1-2 Days
marketNews.content: Axios reported that US Secretary of State Antony Blinken informed G7 countries on Sunday (4/8) that attacks by Iran and Hezbollah against Israel could start in the next 1-2 days at the earliest. Iran and Hezbollah themselves have vowed to retaliate for Israel's killing of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh and Hezbollah military commander Fuad Shukr. Blinken reportedly asked other foreign ministers to engage in diplomacy with Iran, Hezbollah, and Israel to prevent wider conflict.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Governor Cautious on Rate Cuts Due to Outflow Risk Amid High US Yields
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, said that his party will be cautious in determining the direction of the BI Rate, considering the risk of capital outflows amidst high US government bond yields. Perry mentioned that Bank Indonesia needs to ensure global risks can be managed before cutting interest rates, even though inflation in Indonesia has currently reached the target range of 1.5-3.5%. Perry also mentioned risks from unsynchronized global monetary policies, although he agreed with the consensus expecting that the Fed will likely start cutting interest rates in September 2024.

marketNews.title: Berkshire Hathaway Sold Nearly Half of its Apple Stock Holding in 2Q24, Increasing Cash Reserves
marketNews.content: Warren Buffett's investment company, Berkshire Hathaway, sold nearly half of its share ownership in Apple during 2Q24. In the 2Q24 financial report, Berkshire Hathaway reported that its Apple ownership is currently valued at 84.2 billion US dollars, a decrease of -49% compared to 1Q24. The sale of Apple shares occurred amidst a broader sell-off move by Berkshire Hathaway, where the company has divested its share ownership valued at more than 75 billion US dollars during 2Q24. This sale caused the company's cash and cash equivalents to surge from 189 billion US dollars in 1Q24 to 277 billion US dollars in 2Q24.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Palm Oil Industry Prepares for La Nina in 2H24, Potential Disruption to Fresh Fruit Bunch Evacuation
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Palm Oil Producers Association, Eddy Martono, stated that the entry of La Nina into Indonesia has the potential to disrupt the evacuation phase of fresh fruit bunches (TBS), thereby potentially lowering production. However, Eddy mentioned that La Nina will not necessarily increase palm oil company revenue, considering that the increase in CPO prices from supply reduction can be offset by production declines from the company. BMKG itself has changed its prediction for the entry of La Nina into Indonesia from initially expected in July 2024 to August-October 2024.

tickerNews.title: DOID and AMMN Rumored to Plan Acquisition of PSAB
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg Technoz reports that Delta Dunia Makmur (DOID) and the Salim group - through Amman Mineral International (AMMN) - each plan to buy 92.5% of J Resources Asia Pasifik (PSAB) shares from its controller, Jimmy Budiarto, in 1Q25. DOID is reportedly bidding for PSAB shares at a price of 300 rupiah per share, while the Salim Group is reportedly bidding at a price of 350 rupiah per share. DOID Director, Iwan Fuad Salim, stated that they are reluctant to respond to rumors or speculation in the market, but do not rule out the possibility of inorganic expansion opportunities. On the other hand, AMMN President Commissioner, Agoes Projosasmito, stated that they have no acquisition plans. PSAB has not yet commented on this issue.

tickerNews.title: Mayora Indah (MYOR) Management Revises Up FY24 Sales Growth Guidance
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah management revised up the FY24 sales growth guidance from high single-digit to +10-12%. This step was taken by considering the continued strength of domestic sales - with double-digit growth at the beginning of 3Q24 - and the recovery of sales in export markets. MYOR management also plans to again raise selling prices for cocoa and coffee products in 3Q24 or 4Q24 along with the continued increase in the prices of these two commodities. With these price adjustments, MYOR management is optimistic that the gross profit margin guidance of a minimum of 25% can be achieved (vs. 1Q24: 23.5%, 1H24: 25.8%).

tickerNews.title: ACES Will Not Extend License Agreement with Ace Hardware Corporation, Royalty Payments to Cease
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia management stated during the earnings call on Monday (5/8) that the company will not extend the license agreement with Ace Hardware Corporation, which is set to expire on December 31, 2024. Without the license, ACES will not need to pay royalty fees, which amounted to 0.53% of total sales in FY23. Nevertheless, savings from these royalty fees will not be immediately visible because advertising and promotion costs for rebranding will be higher. Management provided guidance that advertising and promotion costs in FY25 will reach 3% of total sales (vs. FY23: 1.2% of total sales).

tickerNews.title: AKR Corporindo (AKRA) Controller Increases Ownership Stake
tickerNews.content: The controller of AKR Corporindo, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, purchased 25.2 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,519.9 rupiah per share between July 26 and August 1, 2024. The total transaction value reached 38.3 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, the ownership of PT Arthakencana Rayatama in AKRA increased from 62.4% to 62.53%.

tickerNews.title: Sight Investment Company Ptel. Ltd. Announces New Schedule for Voluntary Tender Offer for SILO Shares
tickerNews.content: The Singaporean investment company, Sight Investment Company Ptel. Ltd., announced a change in the schedule for the voluntary tender offer for approximately 5.9 billion (45%) shares of Siloam International Hospitals (SILO). In the latest schedule, the voluntary tender offer will take place from August 5 to September 3, 2024, with payment on September 13, 2024. The tender offer price remains unchanged at 2,850 rupiah per share, which is approximately +10.1% higher than the average highest price in the 90 days before the initial information disclosure on July 1, 2024.

tickerNews.title: Shareholders in Mega Manunggal Property (MMLP) Owned by Temasek and Anderson Investments Increase Stake via Exchangeable Bonds Exercise
tickerNews.content: Mega Manunggal Property shareholders owned by Temasek Holdings (Private) Ltd. and Anderson Investments Pte. Ltd., purchased approximately 1.2 billion MMLP shares from PT Mega Mandiri Properti and West Bridge Developments Limited at a price of 309 rupiah per share on July 25, 2024, as part of the execution of exchangeable bonds. The total transaction value reached approximately 368 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, the ownership of Anderson Investments Pte. Ltd. in MMLP increased from 6.08% to 23.37%.

tickerNews.title: Dana Brata Luhur (TEBE) to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2024 Book Year
tickerNews.content: Dana Brata Luhur (TEBE) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 book year amounting to approximately 19.3 billion rupiah or 15 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is August 12, 2024, while payment will be on August 26, 2024. Referring to the closing price of TEBE shares on Monday (5/8) at 705 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 2.1%.

tickerNews.title: Samudera Indonesia (SMDR) Realizes 10 Ship Procurements by Early 3Q24, Capex Reaches $100 Million
tickerNews.content: President Director of Samudera Indonesia (SMDR), Bani M. Mulia, stated that his party has realized the procurement of 10 ships by early 3Q24, with capex realization reaching 100 million US dollars out of a total allocation of 280 million US dollars. In 2024, SMDR targets the addition of 12 units of ships.
